#Text=Cancer charity fundraiser and blogger Stephen Sutton dies aged 19
#Text=Wednesday , May 14 , 2014
#Text=United Kingdom blogger and cancer charity fundraiser Stephen Sutton has died today at the age of 19 .

#Text=Sutton , himself a cancer sufferer , gained media attention in the UK for his fundraising activities for Teenage Cancer Trust , which have raised more than £ 3.3 million ( US$ 5.5 million or € 4 million ) for the charity .
#Text=Sutton 's original goal was £10,000 ( US$ 16,800 or € 12,200 ) for the charity .
#Text=His mother said he died in his sleep during the early hours of this morning .
#Text=Stephen Sutton was the most inspiring person I 've ever met and touched more lives than he will ever know — Jason Manford , comedian
#Text=Sutton 's mother broke the news in a post on ' Stephen 's story ' , the Facebook page launched in January 2013 in which Sutton documented events in his life .
#Text=" My heart is bursting with pride but breaking with pain for my courageous , selfless , inspirational son " , she wrote .
#Text=" The ongoing support and outpouring of love for Stephen will help greatly at this difficult time , in the same way as it helped Stephen throughout his journey .

#Text=Unfortunately the breathlessness which had him re-admitted to hospital is due to the regrowth of tumours which are blocking his airways , and not just due to infection as we had all been hoping .

_	_	_	_

#Text=However , the update also said he was  comfortable and stable " .

column1: #Text=Sutton , from the town of Burntwood in the West Midlands of England , was told he was suffering from a metastatic colorectal cancer at the age of 15 .
#Text=On a JustGiving page , Sutton explained why he was raising money for his chosen charity .
#Text=" Teenage Cancer Trust have helped me hugely throughout my own cancer battle and helped shape who I am and my positive attitude today " , he said .
#Text=" They offer hope and a sense of community to young people with cancer like myself , and directly help face associated pragmatic and emotional issues . "

#Text=His fundraising efforts received widespread media attention , part of which was due to a thumbs up image of himself he posted on the Facebook page in April , which he then believed would be his last .
#Text=Sutton 's campaign received numerous celebrity endorsements , including from Stephen Fry , Russell Brand and Simon Cowell .
#Text=Comedian Jason Manford also arranged comedy gigs to assist with Sutton 's campaign .
#Text=On Twitter today , the Teenage Cancer Trust said : " We are humbled and hugely grateful for what Stephen achieved and continues to achieve for us . "
#Text=British Prime Minister tweeted :
#Text=" His spirit , bravery and fundraising for cancer research were all an inspiration . "
#Text=Meanwhile , Leader of the Opposition Ed Miliband said on the social networking site :
#Text=" His bravery & determination to live life to the full was an inspiration to us all . "
#Text=Jason Manford paid his own tribute to Sutton .
#Text=" Stephen Sutton was the most inspiring person I 've ever met and touched more lives than he will ever know " , he said .
#Text=" He was an incredibly positive young man and a credit to his family , to Burntwood and to humanity itself .

#Text=Some of Stephen 's words will stay with me and others forever and they are words to live by — ' life is n't measured in time , it 's measured in achievements ' .
